alert.note: Alert for Coleman; Runnels; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 10:24PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Coleman, southeastern Taylor and northern Runnels Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1024 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Winters Lake, or near Bradshaw, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coleman, Winters, Lawn, Novice, Burkett, Glen Cove, Benoit, Bradshaw, Hatchel, Voss, Silver Valley, Crews, Valera, Talpa, Echo, Wilmeth, Lake Coleman, Ovalo, Goldsboro and Lake Winters Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
